replies.body: UoL is above C9, when C9 thrashed them?
Yeah that's pretty wierd.  C9 is not being consistent and making some mistakes right now, but C9 is absolutely a stronger team than UOL.

But you do realize that these power rankings are not based on the performances of a few moths ago, right? Recently C9 was very inconsistent, and being that inconsistent, they can't really be considered one of the best teams worldwide. UOL, on the other hand, seems to be better almost every time they play, and that's why they definitely deserve being ranked higher than C9.

UoL defeated TSM, TSM defeated C9, C9 defeated UoL, and the loop continues... so what's your point? C9 is extremely inconsistent at the moment, and won't perform better until either: 1. Hai performs better, 2. Hai's shot-calling gets better, or 3. C9 replaces Hai.

Who else is there that's performing much worse than expected? BalIs isn't doing terribly. Meteos is still top 3 junglers in NA. Sneaky is proving that he's much more than just a support-style AD, and closing in on becoming best NA ADC; and because of that, there's no way you drop Lemon and mess with the bot lane chemistry. Thus, Hai's clearly the weak link of the team.

Hai is far from the weakest link for C9. If we look at their most recent loss against Winterfox, Hai was up 10 CS despite roaming twice and being in a disadvantageous matchup, and his shot calling got the team a commanding lead. It was only a couple of poor team fights that killed them, and fight-misplays are not Hai's fault.

Hai regularly agrees to bad matchups that benefit his team, buys and places more wards than any other mid laner, roams continually, and still somehow manages to sometimes win lane and carry a game. We hear all the time that "C9 likes trying to get Balls going" or "they've really focused the bottom lane recently" but I never hear "Meteos is baby sitting the mid lane" like I hear for other (legitimately) stand out mid laners like Bjergsen.

Given Hai's focus towards the team over himself, it should come as no surprise that the rest of his team's performance is among the best in NA. They are, of course, legitimately great players in their own right, but the extra warding, warding, and map pressure Hai regularly exerts cannot be ignored.

Moreover, every team that plays C9 says "we win if we can keep Hai down." If Hai is really the weakest link then C9 should do better when the opposing team puts extra pressure mid and allows the top and bot to carry. But that's not what happens with C9. There's no other player in the LCS that is more indicative of his team's success than Hai.

And then there's the fact that every time C9 loses it's apparently Hai's fault. I don't understand that at all. What other team has a player that everyone blames for literally every loss?

C9 have some serious issues to work out, certainly, but we can't forget either that they had the best showing of any non-Chinese, non-Korean team at Worlds last year. And that's when Hai was legitimately struggling. Maybe it's just time for C9 to go back and say "let's get Hai to carry." That's actually what they did in their first season when Sneaky was more of a carry-support, and it remains their best season. Maybe we shouldn't be surprised that the further they've moved away from Hai as a carry the more they've struggled.

Honestly, I haven't felt Cloud 9 suffering from play or strategy. Looking back on 3 of their 4 losses this year and I felt they had a pretty lousy pick/ban phase.  The game's they've won they brought more hard engage and were the aggressors most of the game.  The game's they've lost they've seemed to bring more late game team comps.

Lately, I think Meteos is having a bit of a time adjusting to new jungle paths and so he's not providing the pressure and snowball that he used to. It would be nice to see the old Ashe Zyra come back to the bot lane, but it seems the winning teams of late have learned C9's old strategy.  Right now the current meta favors aggressive team composition and C9 just seem to be behind that curve.
Why is any Taiwan team above UOL, they are a pretty weak region. Remember when TPA was hyped up at worlds? Remember what happened to them? Oh yeah, they got smashed.
Tell me when UOL wins worlds, then trash TPA
You have to remember AF looked like the best team in the world, and then 2 seasons later they're barely hanging on, then a season after that they're top 3 in Korea. Things change all the time
I'm not saying they're the TPA now that they were then. I'm just saying that because they're a "Tawainese team" doesn't mean they should be discredited anything, and they've earned that.
that was 2 years ago, last year none of the teams in the SEA region even made it out of groups, whereas TSM AT LEAST got to the quarter finals
DW, we will see top LMS teams against mid-lower tier LCS teams soon enough

snake is pretty awesome, coming out from the blue

will remain die hard OMG fan though
Hai should play Veigar, he already gets jumped on enough in the mid-lane. He might as well take someone with him.

Why do you guys always bring archaic notions into these power rankings? It's not that hard to just watch the games to assess the quality of play. If you did that you would see its obvious that LPL is far beyond the quality of play in LCK. You would see that Snake isn't a fluke. "We all agree that they will eventually be overtaken..." Why? As if rookies haven't come on to and destroyed the scene before? MVP Ozone? SKT K? Snake is playing like SKT when they came onto the scene in season 3, with their ADC being the new Faker. You guys take ridiculous notions from past seasons like, "Korea is better than China," when literally everything has changed in the off-season. 

You can keep making your archaic lists and I will keep laughing that you put LGD above Snake, even though they were outclassed in the same league, and putting Najin above Vici (that one is actually hilarious...)

Those expert are all monte cristo all kr fan boy. thats the reason. look at the top team in lck skt vs ge tiger, what a shiity game full of mistake. Snake is 100% better than the 2 shitty top kr team.

technically, Monte's argument that Korean players are better than Chinese players is not wrong.
Vici has Dandy and Mata, SHRC has Insec, EDG has Pawn and Deft... SSW and SSB, as well as other Korean players are making the LPL a lot better. I can assure you that the next team that wins Worlds will have a Korean player on the team.
i agree
Yeah SK up to 8th place.
Yeah! TSM! #1 in NA and moved up a spot in the International ranking too. One step at a time.
Let's hope they beat SK and perform well if they play GE Tigers at IEM Katowice.
TSM will be a different team going into IEM Katowice than IEM San Jose. Excited to see how they measure up on an international scale and if the power rankings are accurate/inaccurate.
but i dont think they will be able to beat SK though
Not so sure after this weeks EU LCS. I'm very suprised.

Najin Em-fire and Star Horn Royal Club are ranked way too high in my opinion. In Najin's case, they have looked below average to mediocre in the LCK. Their one stand alone performance has been against SKT in the first week, first game where they won pretty handidly. Other than that though, they have looked very inferior to the better Korean teams and slightly above average against the lesser teams. 
In Star Horn Royal's case, I don't see how they are in the top twenty to be honest. Insec has been very inconsistent, with more bad performances than good performances. And without Namei for potentially two weeks of play, they could end up at the bottom of the rankings in China.
rly skt 3 :/

TSM goes to worlds, places top 8, then is top of NA.. gets placed 14th.. LOL. This is also after being one of the 2 or 3 teams that were able to take ONE games from the eventual world champs? Might want to start analyzing things like these. World performances SHOULD matter to a certain extent.
But you understand NA as a region is actually weaker than CN or KR, right?
I agree they are weaker than KR or CN but leaps and bounds ahead of EU.

This power ranking is supposed to give an up to date picture of the current situation. Worlds is about half a year ago and pretty irrelevant to these standings. So is the IEM event where TSM got stomped by UOL.
Liquid is better than 7th place personally

Honestly, they're not, at least they haven't shown it by any means.  The teams ahead of them have at least shown that they're SOME sort of a threat.  The problems within Liquid, and the upcoming roster changes paint a picture of an even more uncertain future of inconsistency.  I honestly hope that they can pull it together for the sake of their talent being properly represented.  Xpecial an Dom don't deserve to be in the bottom 5.
I think Team Liquid can make a comeback and be 3rd-5th due to the fact that they're benching Piglet. Week one I felt that they didn't need Piglet and I was right.

Question: how are the international rankings determined? because what it looks like to me is they hate on the EU and NA. How that must feel for SK Gaming to put in this work, having a perfect season, dominating all games, and in W/L/T have the best record in the WORLD, and get ranked behind a 4-3 team. Am I the only one saying WTF?

In sporting leagues that have divisions like AFC, NFC, etc, just because one division is highly competitive and skilled, doesn't mean the 3rd or last place team in that division is ranked above first place teams in other divisions. I hope this gets attention.

7 Chinese teams above the best in NA? It's like they didn't even watch World's last year. The gap is not that big between NA and China. Absolutely no way TSM would be the 8th best team in China. This panel is so blatantly biased. The region that didn't get a single team out of groups last year has their top team at #8, yet NA is at 14 behind 8 Chinese teams. Ridiculous.
